com.nearinfinity.honeycomb.mysql
Class HandlerProxy

java.lang.Object
  com.nearinfinity.honeycomb.mysql.HandlerProxy

public class HandlerProxy
extends Object

Represents the proxy interaction between the storage engine and storage engine backend implementation used to execute operations

createTable

public void createTable(String tableName,
                        byte[] serializedTableSchema,
                        long autoInc)
Create a table with the given specifications. The table is not open when this is called.

Parameters:
tableName - Name of the table
serializedTableSchema - Serialized AvroTableSchema avro object
autoInc - Initial auto increment value

Drop the table with the given specifications. The table is not open when this is called.

Parameters:
tableName - Name of the table to be dropped

renameTable

public void renameTable(String originalName,
                        String newName)
Updates the existing SQL table name representation in the underlying Store implementation to the specified new table name. The table is not open when this is called.

Parameters:
originalName - The existing name of the table, not null or empty
newName - The new table name to represent, not null or empty

public void setAutoIncrement(long value)
Set the auto increment value of the table to the max of value and the current value.

Parameters:
value -

incrementAutoIncrement

public long incrementAutoIncrement(long amount)
Increment the auto increment value of the table by amount, and return the next auto increment value. The next value will be the current value, not the incremented value (equivalently, the incremented value - amount).

Parameters:
amount -
Returns:
The specified amount subtracted from the incremented value

truncateAutoIncrement

public void truncateAutoIncrement()

addIndex

public void addIndex(String indexName,
                     byte[] serializedSchema)
Add the provided index information to the table. The table must be open before this operation can be performed.

Parameters:
indexName - The name of the index to add, not null or empty
serializedSchema - The byte representation of the IndexSchema for this index, not null

dropIndex

public void dropIndex(String indexName)
Drop the index specified by the index name from the table. The table must be open before this operation can be performed.

Parameters:
indexName - The name of the index to add, not null or empty

indexContainsDuplicate

public boolean indexContainsDuplicate(String indexName,
                                      byte[] serializedRow)
Check whether the index contains a row with the same field values and a distinct UUID.

Parameters:
indexName -
serializedRow -
Returns:
True If a duplicate is found, False otherwise
